"If caregivers decided to neglect and refuse to do care, we would all suffer because of their contribution to the economy" - Felister Gitonga, Gender Justice and Women Rights Lead - @OxfamPanAfrica 

#IWD2022

#FeministRecovery 

#BreakTheBias https://t.co/YwrgPqNvl9

“80% of the refugees we are hosting are women and children. Which means, just by virtue of their gender identities, they are already taking up all the care roles of the families that have been displaced by war.” - Wilson Senyoni, Gender & Protection Coordinator, @OxfaminUganda https://t.co/3leNPYeG2O

“In War, in terms of sexual violence, in terms of care work, women carry the burden. And yet, in peacebuilding, women are the least recognised and least represented in decision-making bodies.” - Mary Fatiya, Program Coordinator, Young Women Christian Association, South Sudan https://t.co/iAym5HsSsD

"The gender related concerns in Africa have worsened in the context of COVID-19 and other major crisis e.g. drought in Ethiopia, Kenya and Somali, conflict in different countries, refugee crisis in Uganda among many others." - @NgalaParvin, Regional Director (Interim), Oxfam HECA https://t.co/T7diRIeUVk
